frontmatter.title: How to Set Up a Reusable Link to a Remote Camera
frontmatter.metaTitle: How to Set Up a Reusable Link to a Remote Camera
frontmatter.metaDesc: How to Set Up a Reusable Link to a Remote Camera

pageProps.content:
When a host is in a remote location it is helpful to create a reusable camera link to avoid creating a camera link for each show.

This support note describes how to use OBS.Ninja to create a reusable remote camera link that can be used across shows.  OBS.Ninja is free and does not require an install, it is browser-based.

## How to Set Up a Reusable Link to a Remote Camera

 1. At the OBS location, open your browser and navigate to [https://vdo.ninja/](https://vdo.ninja/ "https://vdo.ninja/")
 2. Select "Create Reusable Invite".

    ![](/blog-assets/AddYourCameraToOBS.png)
 3. Enter a name for your reusable link and select "Generate The Invite Link"![](/blog-assets/CreateReusableInvite.png)
 4. Copy the Guest Invite Link and send it to the remote host by your favorite method, e.g. txt or email.

    ![](/blog-assets/ReusableInvite.png)
 5. Copy the OBS Browser Source Link and open OBS
 6. Select an existing scene or create a new scene.  To create a new scene see the support article "How to create an OBS Scene"
 7. Create a Source, "+" sign at the bottom of the Source window,  lower left side of the screen, and select Browser as a Source
 8. Under "Create new", enter a name and select OK

    ![](/blog-assets/NameBrowserSource.png)
 9. Enter the OBS Browser Source Link into the URL field, select **Control audio via OBS to hear the sound,** and select OK.

    ![](/blog-assets/EnterBrowserURL.png)
10. At the location of the remote host, you will have received the "Guest Invite Link".  Select the "Guest Invite Link" and open it in a browser.
11. Select "Share your Camera".

    ![](/blog-assets/ShareYourCamera.png)
12. Select your video and audio source and then select the "START" button.

    ![](/blog-assets/SelectAudioAndVideo.png)
13. The remote camera will now be showing in OBS.
